means: 浪漫的，谈情说爱的，多情的，风流的，香艳的
空想的，虚构的，怪诞的，想入非非的，不实际的，难实行的（计划等）
传奇（式）的，小说般的，情节离奇的
浪漫主义作家[画家等]，浪漫派诗人[艺术家]

sentence.Network_en: The reality of mothering is frequently very different from the romantic ideal.
sentence.Network_cn: 养育孩子的现实经常与浪漫的理想大相径庭。

sentence.Network_en: She clings to a romantic fantasy of wedded bliss.
sentence.Network_cn: 她沉醉于婚后幸福的浪漫幻想。

sentence.Network_en: There's nothing like candlelight for creating a romantic mood.
sentence.Network_cn: 再没什么比烛光更能营造浪漫气氛了。

means.word_mean: 富于幻想的,古怪的,荒诞离奇的

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent. (referring to the characteristics of romance in a narrative): from archaic romaunt 'tale of chivalry', from an Old French variant of romanz (see romance)

entry.tran: （人）浪漫的，富于浪漫气息的，有情调的
entry.def: Someone who is romantic or does romantic things says and does things that make their wife, husband, girlfriend, or boyfriend feel special and loved.

example.ex: When we're together, all he talks about is business. I wish he were more romantic...
example.tran: 我们在一起的时候，他总是谈论生意。我希望他能更浪漫一点。

example.ex: They enjoyed a romantic dinner for two at one of their favourite restaurants.
example.tran: 他俩在他们最喜欢的一家餐馆里吃了一顿浪漫的二人晚餐。

entry.def: Romantic means connected with sexual love.

example.ex: He was not interested in a romantic relationship with Ingrid.
example.tran: 他并没有兴趣和英格丽德发生性关系。

entry.tran: （戏剧、电影或故事）关于爱情的，浪漫的
entry.def: A romantic play, film, or story describes or represents a love affair.

example.ex: It is a lovely romantic comedy, well worth seeing.
example.tran: 这是一部温馨的爱情喜剧，非常值得一看。

entry.tran: (观点等)不现实的，不切实际的，空想的
entry.def: If you say that someone has a romantic view or idea of something, you are critical of them because their view of it is unrealistic and they think that thing is better or more exciting than it really is.

example.ex: He has a romantic view of rural society...
example.tran: 他对农村的看法不切实际。

example.ex: I don't have any romantic notions about having a baby. It's a really tough job.
example.tran: 我对生孩子并没有抱任何幻想。这的确是件很不容易的事情。

entry.tran: （事物）浪漫的，富有浪漫色彩的，充满浪漫气息的
entry.def: Something that is romantic is beautiful in a way that strongly affects your feelings.

example.ex: Seacliff House is one of the most romantic ruins in Scotland.
example.tran: 海崖城堡是苏格兰最富有浪漫色彩的遗迹之一。
旅行手册上充满浪漫色彩的图片

entry.tran: 浪漫主义的（描述18、19世纪注重抒发个人情感的艺术运动）
entry.def: Romantic means connected with the artistic movement of the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries which was concerned with the expression of the individual's feelings and emotions.

example.ex: ...the poems and prose of the English romantic poets.
example.tran: 英国浪漫主义诗人的诗歌和散文

means.word_mean: 2. an artist of the romantic period or someone influenced by romanticism
1. belonging to or characteristic of romanticism or the Romantic movement in the arts;
2. expressive of or exciting sexual love or romance;
3. not sensible about practical matters; unrealistic;

sentences.sentence: "as quixotic as a restoration of medieval knighthood"
"a wild-eyed dream of a world state"

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词,"人或科学"; 2. 表形容词,通常放在名词后,表示"与……相关的,……的"; 3. 表名词,"某种药或医学有关"

stems_affixes.word_buile: lunate月+ic人或科学→lunatic月亮的圆缺引起精神病等

stems_affixes.value_cn: 浪漫的,传奇式的;不切实际的,好幻想的
stems_affixes.word_buile: roman浪漫+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.浪漫的,传奇式的;不切实际的,好幻想的
a无,缺乏+pathe=path感情+tic与……相关的,……的→无动于衷的
aroma芳香+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.芳香的
chao混乱+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.混乱的
charisma超凡魅力,感召力+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.有魅力的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 戏剧的,戏剧性的;剧烈的
stems_affixes.word_buile: drama戏剧+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.戏剧的,戏剧性的;剧烈的
enigma谜+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.神秘的,难解的
gene因子,基因+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.遗传[学]的 n.[-s]遗传学
schema=scheme图解,摘要+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.扼要的,图解的
psych心理[的]+o+tic人或科学→adj.&n.精神病的,疯子
lunate月+ic人或科学→lunatic月亮的圆缺引起精神病等
gene因子,基因+tic与……相关的,……的→adj.遗传[学]的 n.[-s]遗传学
anti反+bio生命+tic某种药或医学有关→反生命→反细菌→抗生素

Sentence.sentence: contributes to environmental protection Romantic love has clear evolutionary roots but our views about what makes an ideal romantic relationship can be swayed by the society we live in

In the absence of societal pressures to maintain pair-bonds, O'Sullivan suggests that romantic love has increasingly come to be seen as the factor that should determine who we stay with and for how long
That's why historically we see an increase in romantic love as a basis for forming long-term relationships," she says.
Later we interact with teachers, friends, romantic partners, and coworkers who communicate their views of us.

means.word_mean: 富于浪漫色彩的, 充满传奇情调的

sentences.en: Romantic fiction can no longer attract her.
sentences.cn: 浪漫小说已不再能吸引她了。

sentences.en: She thinks it will be romantic to be an actress.
sentences.cn: 她认为当个女演员会很浪漫。

sentences.en: Don't get carried away with romantic notions.
sentences.cn: 不要被不切实际的想法弄得忘乎所以。

sentences.en: The professor was a person with romantic ideals.
sentences.cn: 那个教授是一个浪漫主义者。

sentences.en: He tends to be romantic owing to lack of experience.
sentences.cn: 由于缺乏经验, 他有浪漫主义的倾向。

jushi.english: Don't get carried away with romantic notions.
jushi.chinese: 不要被不切实际的想法弄得忘乎所以了。

jushi.english: The professor was a person with romantic ideals.
jushi.chinese: 那个教授是一个浪漫主义者。
